contrasts.commentary: Negative language centers on absence and failure (“not”, “no”), whereas positive talk names outcomes (“good”, “love”) and assets (“stock”). The shift suggests problems are framed as blockers, while praise points to tangible benefits.
Where negative posts pause on what’s broken, positive ones move forward with “new”, “best”, or specific days, implying progress and timeliness.

recommendations.message: Acknowledge friction succinctly, pivot to a concrete next step or workaround.
Lean into items/experiences fans already call “good” or “best”; bundle them with timely “new” drops.
